meanings.definition: A government building where duties are collected on imported goods.
meanings.sent1: The customhouse is where taxes are paid on items brought into the country.
meanings.sent2: I had to go to the customhouse to pay the fees on the goods I imported.
meanings.sent3: The customhouse clerk joked that they should start offering tours for all the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The customhouse stood like a fortress guarding the entrance to the port.
meanings.sent5: The customhouse loomed large in the harbor, a symbol of government control over trade.

meanings.definition: The duties collected on imported goods.
meanings.sent1: The customhouse fees added up quickly for the merchant.
meanings.sent2: Importers grumbled about the high customhouse charges on their shipments.
meanings.sent3: The customhouse taxes seemed to magically increase every time a new shipment arrived.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the customhouse duties burdened the small business owner.
meanings.sent5: The customhouse levies were a constant headache for those in the import business.

meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a career in customhouse operations.
meanings.sent2: The customhouse business was booming due to increased international trade.
meanings.sent3: The customhouse industry was known for its strict regulations and paperwork.
meanings.sent4: He found success in the customhouse sector, managing imports and exports efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The world of customhouse management required attention to detail and knowledge of trade laws.
